title: Designing a Conceptual Competency-Based Classroom Engagement Model

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific theories and practical application experience in the field
context.additional_context: Interaction-based and spatial metaphor-driven activity design environments using digital devices

learning_goals: Learners' conceptual competencies in science activities are diagnosed in three stages (self-assessment, peer assessment, instructor feedback) to analyze engagement patterns.
Activity designs applying spatial metaphors (zones, topographical maps) increase learner movement paths and interaction frequency by 20%.
Adjusting the difficulty and navigability of activity areas based on formative assessment data improves participation sustainability by 15%.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
